org.epochx.life
Class GenerationAdapter

java.lang.Object
  org.epochx.life.GenerationAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
GenerationListener
public abstract class GenerationAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements GenerationListener

Provides an abstract implementation of GenerationListener.

Typical use of this class would be in an anonymous class. For example: 

     model.getLifeCycleListener().addGenerationListener(new GenerationAdapter(){
                public void onGenerationStart() {
                        ... do something ...
                }
     });

Creating an anonymous implementation of this class is often preferable to implementing GenerationListener since it avoids the need to implement methods which may be of no interest.

Specified by:
onGenerationStart in interface GenerationListener

onGeneration

public java.util.List<CandidateProgram> onGeneration(java.util.List<CandidateProgram> pop)
Event fired after a generation has been carried out. The resultant population may be modified and returned. This event is revertable by returning null which will trigger the population to be discarded and for the whole generation to be performed again from the previous population. This event will then be raised again. If the generation should be accepted then the population should be returned as it is.

Specified by:
onGeneration in interface GenerationListener
Parameters:
pop - the population that is the result of carrying out the generation.
Returns:
the list of programs that should become the next population, or null if the generation should be reverted.

onGenerationEnd

public void onGenerationEnd()
Event fired once a generation has ended and been accepted.

Specified by:
onGenerationEnd in interface GenerationListener
